intro: Triplasis floridana, commonly known as the Florida triplasis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
